perturbation.changed_text: 3.00 Company grants to Investor, for the duration of the Option Period, a worldwide, royalty-free, non-exclusive, terminable license (with the right to grant sublicenses to Affiliates) under the Patents to practice the methods therein described and claimed and to make and have made, use, offer to sell, sell and import products made using such methods, and to make Improvements, and to engage in any activity which would give rise to a claim of infringement (direct or indirect or otherwise) of one or more of the Patents in the absence of a license.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'irrevocable' has been replaced with 'terminable.' The original text grants an irrevocable license, meaning it cannot be revoked. The modified text uses 'terminable', implying the license can be terminated under certain conditions (although unspecified here, and creates conflict with subsequent articles that implicitly treat it as irrevocable until option expiry). This creates a direct contradiction.
